descriptions.title: An Overview of Dzelung Mé
descriptions.content: Lower Dzelung (mdzes lung smad) was one of the eighteen Gyelrong (rgyal rong) kingdoms. The commander of Lower Dzelung was Gyelrong Tibetan and formerly had been subordinate to Tsenlha Gyelpo (btsan lha rgyal po) in Tsenlha (known as Minor Jinchuan, 小金川 ). Due to their military exploits in the Qing campaigns to pacify Chuchen (chu chen, Greater Jinchuan, 大金川) and Tsenlha, the brothers Yong Wenyue and Yong Wensheng in 1776 were appointed Indigenous Garrison Commander of Lower and Upper Dzelung, respectively. There were 243 households under their rule. The annual pay for the commander was twenty-four taels of silver.
